para.text: The Commission shall notify each State facility operator of the placement of an individual on the voluntary exclusion list established in COMAR 36.01.03.
A facility operator may disclose information about an individual on the voluntary exclusion list to:
The Commission;
The facility’s:
Manager;
Security department;
Surveillance department; or
Employees who are directly responsible for excluding unauthorized individuals from the facility; and
If the facility operator pursues criminal charges against an individual on the voluntary exclusion list who is suspected of trespassing at a video lottery facility, to:
A law enforcement officer; or
A person who is legally authorized to be involved in the criminal prosecution of an individual on the voluntary exclusion list who is suspected of trespassing at a video lottery facility.
If a facility operator uses technology for the purpose of complying with §E of this regulation, the facility operator shall ensure that the technology:
Complies with all applicable State requirements; and
Is designed to prevent unauthorized access to confidential records.
If an individual on the voluntary exclusion list is found on the premises of a video lottery facility, the operator:
Shall immediately notify the Commission; and
May pursue criminal charges against the individual for trespassing or any other appropriate criminal charge.
A facility operator may not:
Permit an individual on the voluntary exclusion list to:
Enter into the video lottery facility; or
Play a video lottery terminal or table game;
Knowingly fail to exclude from the premises an individual on the voluntary list; or
Disclose information about individuals on the voluntary exclusion list beyond the disclosures that are authorized under §B of this regulation.

A facility shall establish a responsible gaming plan that sets forth the facility’s plan for addressing problem gambling at the facility that shall include at least the following elements of the plan:
Goals;
Procedures and deadlines for implementation;
Identification of facility personnel responsible for implementation;
Responsibilities of facility personnel identified as responsible for implementation;
Training for facility personnel on problem gambling and voluntary exclusion;
Means of controlling access to records pertaining to voluntary exclusion;
Means of educating players about:
Problem gambling;
Problem gambling treatment resources, including treatment and prevention programs established under State Government Article, §9-1A-33, Annotated Code of Maryland; and
Voluntary exclusion;
Placement of responsible gambling awareness materials in the facility as required under Regulation .03 of this chapter;
Ensuring that an individual in the Voluntary Exclusion Program is not permitted to:
Enter the video lottery facility;
Play a video lottery terminal or table game; or
Claim a jackpot;

The facility’s response to the discovery of an individual who is enrolled in the voluntary exclusion program on facility property, which may include pursuing criminal charges against the individual; and
Any other element required by the Commission.
A facility operator shall submit to the Commission the responsible gaming plan required under §A of this regulation at least 60 days before video lottery terminal operations are to commence.
A facility operator shall submit any amendments to a facility’s responsible gaming plan to the Commission prior to implementation.

A facility operator shall submit to the Commission an annual report describing the facility’s responsible gaming plan, which shall include a statement regarding compliance with Regulation .01C of this chapter.
Definitions.
In this regulation the following terms have the meaning indicated.
Terms Defined.
“Advertisement”: means any material that is:
Disseminated to the public through broadcasting, publication, mail, or any other means; and
Intended to encourage video lottery terminal or table game play.
“Billboard advertisement” means a roadside sign, aviation banner, or event banner that is intended to encourage video lottery terminal or table game play.
“Gambling assistance message” means a phrase approved by the Commission to encourage responsible play;

“Printed advertisement” means an advertisement that appears in or on a sign, direct mailing, poster, brochure or other written material and is intended to encourage video lottery terminal or table game play.
“Responsible gambling awareness materials” means a sticker, a brochure, a wallet card, or other material that conveys only problem gambling resource information.
“Underage warning message” means the phrase: “No patron under the age of 21 is permitted on the casino floor”.
A facility operator shall:
Post signage approved by the Commission that prominently bears the gambling assistance message and the underage warning message at each customer entrance to the gaming floor;
Include the gambling assistance message on an advertisement that is intended to encourage video lottery terminal or table game play at its facility;
Ensure that a printed advertisement bears the gambling assistance message and meets requirements of COMAR 36.03.03.08;
Ensure that a billboard bearing a printed advertisement bears the gambling assistance message and meets requirements of COMAR 36.03.03.08;
Ensure that a radio, television, or video advertisement bears the gambling assistance message and meets requirements of COMAR 36.03.03.08;
Ensure that the gambling assistance message is printed on a paper product that is associated with player consumption of food or beverage if the paper product is:
Special ordered; and
Branded with the facility's logo;
Ensure that the gambling assistance message is printed on ticket stock;
Place in the facility responsible gambling awareness materials according to its responsible gaming plan required under Regulation .02 of this chapter; and
Ensure that the gambling assistance message is conspicuous and readable.
